instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message:
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD][URL='https://everymac.com/systems/apple/macbook-air/specs/macbook-air-core-i5-1.8-13-mid-2012-specs.html']MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.8 13" (Mid-2012)[/URL]
ID 5,2
Model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC 2559[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

I have a Macbook Air with extremely slow mouse / non moving mouse.
In OS X it's a bit better with an external mouse but not brilliant. In Linux there is no issue with either.
We replaced the trackpad with no effect. 
The computer is "usable" in safe mode so I was wondering if something like this software could be an ASD alternative? [URL]https://www.tunabellysoftware.com/tgpro/[/URL]

I tried to run ASD 3S115 however when I attempt to boot to that drive I get an angry beep and the computer restarts.
I believe I need ASD 3S150 based on the link below however the download for that doesn't work! Failure to extract or somesuch error. 

[URL]https://www.loremipsum.info/ia-tools-blog/[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> works with ASD 3S144 (2011) and ASD 3S155 (2012).

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message: I don't suppose anybody has a download for these?

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message:
Sorry, wrong understood; you have an Air 2012.

Try this one.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pqx6Q8-qfeofyZcp7aWAb3MY23tC9DD_/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message:
Thanks that download worked. I am running the tests now. The touch-pad is still going crazy even in ASD, I have replaced it. Could this be something else?

The behavior has now changed from not moving much / very slow. (Mac also runs slow) to randomly jumping around the screen. 

It's up to memory tests now so I guess that rules out sensors.?

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message: Did you try board in different TopCase to opt out keyboard? it might cause same behaviour with faulty keyboard, and of course try with good clean IPD cable.

threads.title: Macbook Air Suspected sensor issue - ASD issues +
threads.message: I have not moved yet but I unplugged the keyyboard and the cursor has stopped moving around like crazy but it's still sluggish.  2 - 3 second delay after moving my finger. I'll move the motherboard tomorrow to a new case / trackpad.
